com.google.android.exoplayer2.upstream.cache

Class CachedContentIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.exoplayer2.upstream.cache.CachedContentIndex

  • class CachedContentIndex
extends java.lang.Object
    This class maintains the index of cached content.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CachedContentIndex

        public CachedContentIndex(java.io.File cacheDir)
        Creates a CachedContentIndex which works on the index file in the given cacheDir.
        Parameters:
        cacheDir - Directory where the index file is kept.

      • CachedContentIndex

        public CachedContentIndex(java.io.File cacheDir,
                          byte[] secretKey)
        Creates a CachedContentIndex which works on the index file in the given cacheDir.
        Parameters:
        cacheDir - Directory where the index file is kept.
        secretKey - 16 byte AES key for reading and writing the cache index.

      • CachedContentIndex

        public CachedContentIndex(java.io.File cacheDir,
                          byte[] secretKey,
                          boolean encrypt)
        Creates a CachedContentIndex which works on the index file in the given cacheDir.
        Parameters:
        cacheDir - Directory where the index file is kept.
        secretKey - 16 byte AES key for reading, and optionally writing, the cache index.
        encrypt - Whether the index will be encrypted when written. Must be false if secretKey is null.

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load()
        Loads the index file.

      • store

        public void store()
           throws Cache.CacheException
        Stores the index data to index file if there is a change.
        Throws:
        Cache.CacheException

      • add

        public CachedContent add(java.lang.String key)
        Adds the given key to the index if it isn't there already.
        Parameters:
        key - The cache key that uniquely identifies the original stream.
        Returns:
        A new or existing CachedContent instance with the given key.

      • get

        public CachedContent get(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a CachedContent instance with the given key or null if there isn't one.

      • getAll

        public java.util.Collection<CachedContent> getAll()
        Returns a Collection of all CachedContent instances in the index. The collection is backed by the keyToContent map, so changes to the map are reflected in the collection, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the collection is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation), the results of the iteration are undefined.

      • assignIdForKey

        public int assignIdForKey(java.lang.String key)
        Returns an existing or new id assigned to the given key.

      • getKeyForId

        public java.lang.String getKeyForId(int id)
        Returns the key which has the given id assigned.

      • removeEmpty

        public void removeEmpty(java.lang.String key)
        Removes CachedContent with the given key from index. It shouldn't contain any spans.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If CachedContent isn't empty.

      • removeEmpty

        public void removeEmpty()
        Removes empty CachedContent instances from index.

      • getKeys

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getKeys()
        Returns a set of all content keys. The set is backed by the keyToContent map, so changes to the map are reflected in the set, and vice-versa. If the map is modified while an iteration over the set is in progress (except through the iterator's own remove operation), the results of the iteration are undefined.

      • setContentLength

        public void setContentLength(java.lang.String key,
                             long length)
        Sets the content length for the given key. A new CachedContent is added if there isn't one already with the given key.

      • getContentLength

        public long getContentLength(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the content length for the given key if one set, or C.LENGTH_UNSET otherwise.

      • readFile

        private boolean readFile()

      • writeFile

        private void writeFile()
                throws Cache.CacheException
        Throws:
        Cache.CacheException

      • add

        private void add(CachedContent cachedContent)

      • addNew

        void addNew(CachedContent cachedContent)
        Adds the given CachedContent to the index.

      • addNew

        private CachedContent addNew(java.lang.String key,
                             long length)

      • getCipher

        private static javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher()
                                      throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                             java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • getNewId

        public static int getNewId(android.util.SparseArray<java.lang.String> idToKey)
        Returns an id which isn't used in the given array. If the maximum id in the array is smaller than Integer.MAX_VALUE it just returns the next bigger integer. Otherwise it returns the smallest unused non-negative integer.
